main event: On March 6, 1954, in Norwich, Connecticut, hundreds of people observed a spherical, silver object that appeared to be intelligently controlled, moving erratically and emitting no sound.
interesting points: The object was observed by hundreds of people in Eastern Connecticut and was described as spherical, silver, and around 200 yards in diameter.
Witnesses reported the object to be illuminated from within and rotating about a vertical axis at times.
Observers estimated the object's height at 10,000 - 12,000 feet and noted that its movement did not coincide with the wind direction.
Some observers saw what resembled 'jet blast' coming from the object, indicating potential propulsion.
Several credible witnesses, including pilots, former pilots, and engineers, were sure that the object was not a balloon.
sighted object: spherical, silver object with erratic movement and no sound emission
witnesses: Hundreds of observers, including credible witnesses such as pilots, former pilots, and engineers
